properties.description: Real-time fleet management for Public Service Vehicles (PSVs), while keeping riders updated on the public network.
properties.how_does_your_company_use_innovation__th: Using real-time phone-based tracking similar to Uber, dynamic fleet management and data monetization to transform how van owners run their operations. This tech-first model streamlines daily management while creating new income streams, turning mobility data into actionable insights for insurers, city planners and beyond for better data-backed decision making, directly linked to a healthy and happy future.
properties.how_does_your_product_contribute_to_a_he: BajanWheels empowers fleet owners with ideal tools to manage smarter, understand their assets' full earning potential, and offer full visibility of their buses and drivers in real time. Streamlining operations, unlocking new revenue for data insights, and helping owners build sustainable livelihoods. Riders benefit too, with safer, more reliable transit supporting better quality of life.
properties.name: BajanWheels Ltd
properties.please_expand:
This is my first time building a business, and I already want to build many more. Having the best minds around will help avoid the typical failures of entrepreneurs, which I may already be facing while moving quickly. A team of your expertise will highlight blind spots and broaden my scope of possibilities when navigating the business arena.
Your advice and support are more valuable than any possible funding, although still welcome.
properties.what_best_describes_your_stage_of_busine: I have an idea and want help building a business
properties.what_is_your_usp__what_makes_you_differe:
No current competition in the fleet management of the cashless payment space in Barbados.
USP is the ability for the currently segmented market to see their entire fleet in one place for the first time, including earnings reports.
properties.where_is_your_business_based_: Not currently UK but in process of becoming UK

pitch_deck_analysis.raw_text:
BajanWheels
Bajan data, moving Bajans smarter.
CONTACT US:
Email: brandonlouis@bajanwheels.com
Phone: +1(246)850-2703
Book a Call: https://shorturl.at/AzSHW

THE PROBLEM
3 Biggest Challenges:
Uninsured, "pirate" vans are becoming prevalent.
Shortage of safe, responsible drivers.
Constant reckless driving.

HIDDEN COST FOR FLEET OWNERS
Fleet owners are losing control of their own business.
No Real-Time Fleet Tracking & Management.
Owners invest in vans
they can’t see in real-
time, how they’re driven,
Cash Theft & Under-reporting.
or what they’re truly
earning.
Reckless driving. Driver misconduct. More accidents.

THE SOLUTION: BAJANWHEELS
Track vans. Track income. Own your fleet again.
Product Demo
KEY FEATURES:
Real-Time Fleet Tracking & Management
Driver behavior & trip analytics.
Daily earnings reporting.
Telematics insights sales to businesses, insurance companies and
governments - unlocking actionable data into strategic intelligence.

WHY NOW?
Fleet owners are demanding visibility - we're the first to give them real control.
"We need this, especially owners."
- Chairman AOPT
Surge in real-time tracking demand → >75% wait list conversion in 3 weeks — with $0 ad spend.
Waitlist made up of local and tourist riders, owners and government ministers.
Smartphone penetration >80% (341.7K Barbados mobile connections = 121% of population)
Data shows a 72% likelihood to use public transportation once digitised.
Backed by Microsoft for Startups, unlocking up to $150K (USD) Azure credits.
Waitlist built in Azure, with continuous MVP development.

MARKET OPPORTUNITIES
Hundreds of vans. Millions of rides. Currently no systems.

~304 public buses + ~800 PSVs,

Source: Barbados Today; LinkedIn; Fortune Business Insights

GO-TO-MARKET PLAN
Target 60 PSV operators via direct outreach & pilots.
Metric: Launch 60 vans → BDS 6K/mo. → BDS 72K ARR
Upsell analytics commercially to insurers & governments.
Market Size: Unlocking access to USD 100 B + telematics & analytics markets.
Launch rider-side app for tracking, loyalty & ad monetisation.
Expand network utility & network verticals when at least 30% of owners register.
Currency Conversion
USD 1 = BDS 2

THE TEAM
Brandon Louis Aaron Yearwood
Looking for CTO
CEO & Founder Non-Executive Director
5 years in Business >5 years in HSE + Award- Technical co-founder,
Intelligence for Award- winning movie Director + versed in full-stack web app
winning ad-campaigns + Disney Actor + Author + development.
NEBOSH-Certified ESG KPMG (Audit)
Strategist + AI/ML
Consultant
We're nothing without our partners.
Holding Company (UK) Founders Hub Dr. Simon Wallace
Demonstrandum UK, CEO
Award-winning consultancy USD 150K credits
Data Advisor
in the Sustainability space.

THE ASK
Raising USD 50K (~ £39.5K) via a Post‑Money SAFE at an $1M (~£790K) value cap — 5% of the company.
Funding:
1 Technical Hire (Equity Available).
Onboarding owners and riders across Barbados.
MVP deployment & go-to-market with light marketing.

Thank
You!
Questions?

Email: brandonlouis@bajanwheels.com
Phone: +1(246)850-2703
Book a Call: https://shorturl.at/AzSHW

structured_data.executive_summary: BajanWheels is a fleet management and tracking solution for public service vehicles in Barbados, providing real-time tracking, driver behavior analytics, and earnings reporting to help fleet owners regain control of their businesses. The company aims to address issues like uninsured vans, shortage of responsible drivers, and reckless driving while creating opportunities in the telematics and transportation analytics markets.
structured_data.problem_statement: Fleet owners are losing control of their businesses due to: 1) Uninsured, 'pirate' vans becoming prevalent, 2) Shortage of safe, responsible drivers, 3) Constant reckless driving, 4) No real-time fleet tracking and management, 5) Cash theft and under-reporting, leading to owners investing in vans they can't monitor in real-time.
structured_data.solution: BajanWheels provides a platform that allows fleet owners to track vans, monitor income, and regain control of their fleet through real-time tracking and management, driver behavior and trip analytics, and daily earnings reporting. The solution also offers telematics insights sales to businesses, insurance companies, and governments.
structured_data.product_service_description: BajanWheels offers a fleet management system with key features including: 1) Real-time fleet tracking and management, 2) Driver behavior and trip analytics, 3) Daily earnings reporting, 4) Telematics insights sales to businesses, insurance companies, and governments - transforming actionable data into strategic intelligence.
structured_data.market_size_opportunity: The total addressable market includes approximately 304 public buses and 800 PSVs in Barbados, with a BDS 140M+/year fare economy. The commercial telematics market is valued at USD 57.6B in 2024, growing to USD 372B by 2032. Insurance telematics is USD 4.45B in 2024, forecasted at USD 18.7B by 2032. Transport analytics is USD 13.3B in 2024, projected to be USD 94.2B by 2034. The serviceable addressable market initially targets ~600 PSVs at BDS 100/month, generating BDS 60K/month or BDS 720K/year in subscription revenue.
structured_data.business_model: BajanWheels operates on a subscription model charging fleet owners BDS 100/month per vehicle. Additional revenue streams include selling analytics commercially to insurers and governments, and plans to launch a rider-side app for tracking, loyalty, and ad monetization.
structured_data.team: The team consists of Brandon Louis (CEO & Founder with 5 years in Business Intelligence), Aaron Yearwood (Non-Executive Director with >5 years in HSE, award-winning movie Director, Disney Actor, Author, and KPMG Audit experience), and they are looking for a CTO with full-stack web app development experience. Partners include Demonstrandum UK (award-winning consultancy in the Sustainability space), Microsoft for Startups Founders Hub (providing USD 150K credits), and Dr. Simon Wallace (Data Advisor).
structured_data.traction_milestones: The company has achieved >75% waitlist conversion in 3 weeks with $0 ad spend. The waitlist includes local and tourist riders, owners, and government ministers. They are backed by Microsoft for Startups, unlocking up to $150K (USD) Azure credits. The waitlist is built in Azure, with continuous MVP development.
structured_data.financials_projections: Year-1 projection targets 60 vans (10% penetration) generating BDS 6K/month, resulting in BDS 72K ARR as initial run rate.
structured_data.funding_ask_use_of_funds: Raising USD 50K (~ £39.5K) via a Post-Money SAFE at an $1M (~£790K) value cap — 5% of the company. Funds will be used for: 1) One technical hire (equity available), 2) Onboarding owners and riders across Barbados, 3) MVP deployment & go-to-market with light marketing.
structured_data.go_to_market_strategy: The go-to-market plan involves targeting 60 PSV operators via direct outreach and pilots, with a metric of launching 60 vans to generate BDS 6K/month and BDS 72K ARR. They plan to upsell analytics commercially to insurers and governments, unlocking access to USD 100B+ telematics and analytics markets. Additionally, they will launch a rider-side app for tracking, loyalty, and ad monetization, and expand network utility and verticals when at least 30% of owners register.

founder_profiles.name: Brandon L.
founder_profiles.background_summary: Brandon L. is an early-career founder with a background in Economics and Finance, currently enhancing his technical skills with a post-graduate program in AI/ML. He is the Founder of BajanWheels, a digital public transit companion for Barbados, and also Founder & CEO of OWL Solutions, an entity focused on solving societal problems and incubating businesses like BajanWheels. He is enthusiastic, detail-oriented, and eager to learn within the digital environment. Brandon demonstrates leadership through his founder roles and past experience as a Business Intelligence Project Lead at 59A, where he managed a global team and was awarded Employee of the Year 2021. He has won the 2020 Microsoft PowerApps Hackathon and spoken at the UN Food Summit and the World Sustainability Conference. He holds ambassador roles with Island Innovation, Digital Ambassador, and DigiLearning Ambassador, indicating community involvement and a commitment to impact. His ventures focus on societal problem-solving, safety, sustainability, and community empowerment.

previous_companies.description: Founder of a digital public transit companion for Barbados.
Company focused on solving societal problems and incubating businesses like BajanWheels.
Managed a global team; awarded Employee of the Year 2021.

investment_criteria_assessment.assessment_summary: Brandon L. is a mission-driven founder with strong alignment to our focus industries and values. He has founded relevant ventures, demonstrated leadership and technical skills, and engaged in impactful community and sustainability initiatives. His background and achievements indicate he is smart, strategic, and well-positioned to build an exciting solution to a real problem.

company_profile.description: BajanWheels Ltd is shaping Barbados' future transit network by providing a public transit companion platform. The company offers real-time updates, seamless payments, and a safer commute for public transportation users in Barbados.
company_profile.business_model: B2C and B2B platform providing digital transit solutions, likely monetized through transaction fees, partnerships with transit authorities, and value-added services.
company_profile.target_customer: Commuters and public transit users in Barbados, as well as local transit authorities seeking digital solutions.
company_profile.mission_statement: Shaping Barbados' future transit network and providing a safer, more efficient public transportation experience.

market_analysis.industry_overview: The transportation and logistics industry encompasses companies that provide services for the movement of people and goods. It includes logistics, air freight, marine, road, rail, and related infrastructure. The industry is foundational to global trade, with logistics alone valued at over €5.7 trillion in the EU and trillions globally. It is characterized by its critical role in supply chains, significant employment, and substantial contribution to GDP in many regions.
market_analysis.target_market_segment: Businesses and organizations requiring the movement of goods (B2B and B2C), including manufacturers, retailers, e-commerce companies, and consumers. Segments include freight, contract logistics, warehousing, last-mile delivery, and specialized transport (e.g., healthcare, perishables).
market_analysis.market_size_tam: $6.23T (2024, transportation and logistics market, Business Research Insights); other estimates for logistics alone range from $5.65T to $11.26T depending on scope and source.
market_analysis.market_growth_rate_cagr: 4.8% (2024-2033, Business Research Insights); other sources estimate 5.1% (2024-2031, Data Bridge), and up to 6.3% for logistics (2025-2034, Expert Market Research).
key_market_trends: Rapid growth of e-commerce driving demand for faster, more flexible logistics and last-mile delivery.
Adoption of automation, AI, and digital platforms for real-time tracking, route optimization, and supply chain visibility.
Sustainability initiatives: shift toward green logistics, electric vehicles, and emissions reduction.
Increased regionalization and nearshoring due to geopolitical shifts and supply chain disruptions.
Labor shortages and the need for workforce optimization.
Growth in demand for warehousing and fulfillment services.
Experimentation with autonomous vehicles and drones.
Integration of big data and IoT for predictive analytics and operational efficiency.
market_analysis.competitor_landscape_summary: The global transportation and logistics market is highly fragmented, with a mix of large multinational corporations and numerous regional and specialized players. The top companies include integrated logistics providers, freight forwarders, and e-commerce giants with in-house logistics. Market share is distributed among a few large players (e.g., DHL, UPS, FedEx, Maersk) and many smaller firms. M&A activity is robust, especially in North America and Asia-Pacific.

competitors.name: DHL (Deutsche Post AG)
strengths: Global network and brand recognition
Comprehensive logistics and supply chain solutions
Strong presence in contract logistics and freight forwarding
weaknesses: Exposure to global economic and regulatory risks

competitors.name: United Parcel Service (UPS)
strengths: Extensive ground and air delivery network
Strong technology integration for tracking and logistics
Diverse service offerings (parcel, freight, supply chain)
weaknesses: Competition from Amazon and other integrators

competitors.name: FedEx Corporation
strengths: Global express delivery leader
Advanced logistics technology
Strong brand and customer service
weaknesses: High exposure to fuel price volatility

competitors.name: A.P. Moller - Maersk
strengths: World's largest container shipping company
Integrated logistics and supply chain services
Strong presence in ocean freight and port operations
weaknesses: Cyclical exposure to global trade volumes

competitors.name: Amazon Logistics
strengths: Massive scale and technology-driven operations
Integrated with e-commerce platform
Rapid innovation in last-mile and fulfillment

company_competitive_advantages: Global reach and integrated service offerings
Advanced technology for tracking, automation, and analytics
Strong brand recognition and customer trust
Ability to scale and adapt to changing market demands
Expertise in regulatory compliance and cross-border logistics
barriers_to_entry: High capital requirements for fleet, infrastructure, and technology
Complex regulatory and compliance landscape (international and local)
Established networks and economies of scale among incumbents
Access to distribution channels and strategic partnerships
Labor shortages and need for skilled workforce
Technological barriers (automation, real-time tracking, data integration)
market_analysis.market_timing_assessment: Mature but growing; the market is highly competitive with ongoing innovation, consolidation, and new entrants driven by e-commerce and technology. M&A activity is robust, and the sector is adapting to new trends such as sustainability and automation.
market_analysis.regulatory_environment: The global transportation and logistics industry is governed by a complex web of international, regional, and national regulations. Key frameworks include International Maritime Organization (IMO) rules for shipping, International Air Transport Association (IATA) standards for air freight, and various customs, trade, and environmental regulations. Compliance with safety, emissions, and labor laws is critical. Increasing focus on environmental regulations (e.g., emissions caps, green logistics mandates) and digital compliance (e.g., data protection, electronic documentation) is shaping industry practices.

investment_assessment.overall_criteria_summary: BajanWheels Ltd meets all six Flight Story investment criteria. The company operates in a relevant sector (transportation technology with a strong digital/AI component), is mission-driven with a clear focus on improving public transit safety, efficiency, and quality of life, and presents a solution that is both innovative and potentially high-impact. The founder, Brandon L., has previously founded another relevant company (OWL Solutions), has impressive experience (Business Intelligence Project Lead, Microsoft PowerApps Hackathon winner, UN/World Sustainability Conference speaker), and demonstrates exceptional intelligence and strategic thinking through his achievements and leadership roles.
key_risk_factors: Early-stage: No revenue or proven product-market fit yet.
Limited technical team: Currently seeking a CTO; technical execution risk.
Small initial market: Barbados is a limited market; international expansion will be challenging.
Competitive landscape: While local competition is limited, global telematics and fleet management is highly competitive.
Regulatory and adoption risk: Success depends on buy-in from fleet owners, drivers, and possibly government authorities.
key_opportunities: First-mover advantage in Barbados for digital fleet management and cashless payments.
Strong waitlist traction (>75% conversion in 3 weeks, including government interest).
Potential to expand into analytics sales to insurers, governments, and other Caribbean markets.
Backed by Microsoft for Startups, providing credibility and technical resources.
Addresses real, urgent problems (safety, theft, inefficiency) with a tech-first approach.
investment_assessment.investment_thesis_summary: BajanWheels is a mission-driven, early-stage company digitizing public transit in Barbados with a compelling founder and strong initial traction. The solution addresses urgent pain points for fleet owners and riders, with potential for broader impact through analytics and regional expansion. The founder demonstrates exceptional drive, relevant experience, and strategic vision, making this a high-upside, high-risk opportunity that aligns closely with Flight Story's thesis.
investment_assessment.potential_return_profile: High risk, high reward. If BajanWheels achieves product-market fit and expands beyond Barbados, there is significant upside in the Caribbean and potentially other emerging markets. Early traction and Microsoft support are promising, but execution and scaling risks remain high.
investment_assessment.deal_terms_summary: Raising $50K (~£39.5K) via a Post-Money SAFE at a $1M (~£790K) value cap for 5% of the company. Funds to be used for technical hire, onboarding, MVP deployment, and go-to-market.
recommended_next_steps: Schedule a partner meeting to discuss the opportunity and founder.
Conduct technical due diligence, focusing on MVP progress and CTO recruitment.
Validate waitlist traction and engagement with fleet owners and government.
Assess scalability and regulatory risks for expansion beyond Barbados.
Explore potential for Flight Story to add value beyond capital (e.g., network, product, go-to-market support).
